net.sf.opengroove.client
Class Storage

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.opengroove.client.Storage

public class Storage
extends Object

This class is used for most access to persistant data.

Author:
Alexander Boyd

Constructor Detail

Storage

protected Storage(String userid)
Creates a storage object for the specified user id. The Storage class maintains singleton instances of storage instances which are lazily initialized.

Parameters:
userid - the userid of the user to create the storage object for. Userids are of the form realm:username
Method Detail

initStorage

public static void initStorage(File file)
Initializes the Storage class. This should only be called once per JVM instance.

Parameters:
file - The file that the storage class should use to store all of it's data

get

public static Storage get(String userid)
Gets the singleton storage object for the specified user. Storage objects are lazily initialized.

Parameters:
realm - The realm of the user
username - The user's username
Returns:
A storage object for the user specified

public static void storeUser(LocalUser user)

user - The user to store

copy

public static void copy(InputStream in,
                        OutputStream out)
                 throws IOException
Copies the contents of one stream to another. Bytes from the source stream are read until it is empty, and written to the destination stream. Neither the source nor the destination streams are flushed or closed.

Parameters:
in - The source stream
out - The destination stream
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

getLocalUser

public static LocalUser getLocalUser(String userid)
Returns the local user for the realm and user specified.

Parameters:
realm - The realm of the user to look up
user - The username of the user to look up
Returns:
The user's information

checkPassword

public static boolean checkPassword(String userid,
                                    String pass)
Checks to make sure that the specified user's password matches the specified password. This can be used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:
realm - the user's realm
username - the user's username
pass - the password that the user entered
Returns:
true if the password entered matches the password stored to the file system, false otherwise.

getAllContacts

public Contact[] getAllContacts()
Gets a list of contacts for this user. This list may be a bit large, so it's best not to over-use this method.

Returns:
a list of contacts for this user.

getContact

public Contact getContact(String realm,
                          String username)
Gets a particular contact by the realm and username specified, returning null if the contact specified does not exist.

Parameters:
realm - The user's realm
username - The user's username
Returns:
The contact, or null if the contact does not exist on this computer

setContact

public void setContact(Contact contact)
adds or updates a contact. If the contact already exists (IE a contact with the same username and realm is present on the file system), the contact's information will be updated. If not, the contact will be created.

Parameters:
contact -

deleteContact

public void deleteContact(String realm,
                          String username)
Deletes the contact specified, throwing a RuntimeException if the operation failed.

Parameters:
realm - the realm of the contact to delete
username - the username of the contact to delete

                                      File file)

readObjectFromFile

private static Serializable readObjectFromFile(File file)
Reads an object from the file specified.

Parameters:
file - The file to read an object from
Returns:
An object, read from the file specified. Only the first object is read, so if the file contains multiple objects, they will not be returned.

recursiveDelete

public static void recursiveDelete(File transmissionFolder)
Recursively deletes a folder. This method first iterates over the folder's contents, deleting each file and folder within that folder, recursively. Then, it deletes the folder passed in. If a particular file or folder couldn't be deleted, a RuntimeException is thrown. If this happens, then some of the tree may still have been deleted.

Parameters:
transmissionFolder -

createIdentifier

public static String createIdentifier()

listObjectContents

public static <T> HashMap<String,T> listObjectContents(File folder,
                                                       Class<T> c)
returns the real storage locations of the attachments on this message. NOTE that the filenames ARE NOT the actual names of the attachments. the filenames are the names of the attachments, prefixed with a "d" if the file is a zip file and was originally sent as a directory, or "f" if it is a regular attachment file.

Parameters:
attachmentSetIdentifier -
Returns:

listObjectContentsAsArray

public static <T> T[] listObjectContentsAsArray(File folder,
                                                Class<T> c)
lists the contents of the specified folder. first, all files of this folder are listed. then, an array is created, that is the same length as those files. the array element type is the class specified in this method. then, for each file, the file is deserialized (the contents of the file are read as an object through an ObjectInputStream created on that file), and added to the array. then the array is returned.

Parameters:
folder - the folder to list
c - the class of the objects to be deserialized, also the class of the return array.
Returns:
an array of deserialized objects, one for each file in this folder.
Throws:
ClassCastException - if the deserialized objects from any of the files are not instances of class c.
